translation.title: Desire, Etc. for the Not-Self Exterior

next.name: The Interior Was Impermanent in the Past

previous.name: Desire, Etc. for the Suffering Exterior

segments.en: 183–185. Desire, Etc. for the Not-Self Exterior

segments.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, anattā, tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed … desire and greed for what is not-self.

segments.pli: Rūpā, bhikkhave, anattā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
segments.en: Sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts are not-self …”

segments.pli: dhammā anattā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
Yo, bhikkhave, anattā tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.

sections.title: “Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed ……
